CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, April 25, 1959, p. 3, reads: "Where Three Tots Died - In center photo, John Jackson, 83, his wife and Mrs. Esther Perkins, who live in the house at 29 Joseph St., are gathered on the front porch with neighbors, after the fire which took the lives of three small tots, ages 1, 2, and 3, of Mr. and Mrs. Norvelle and Marlene Jones, top left photo. Mrs. Perkins, also shown in bottom left photo, age 77, rents adjoining rooms to Mrs. Jones' second-floor apartment and had been asked to look in on the children during the mother's absence.. James Benford, bottom right, summoned by the elderly occupants before firemen arrived, was the first to reach the tots' smoke filled room. He was followed later by Superintendent of Police James Slusser, top right, and together they retrieved two of the bodies of the boys who had already been suffocated by smoke. - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Marlene Jones and Norvelle Jones in front of West's Funeral Home for the funeral of their children, 2216 Centre Avenue, Hill District
